hadithText: A similar report was narrated from 'Aishah from the Messenger of Allah.
"Aishah said: 'Cutting off (the hand of the thief) is for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."'
"The Messenger of Allah used to cut off the (thief's) hand for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'The hand (of the thief) is not to be cut off except for one-quarter of a Dinar."'
"The hand (of the thief) is not to be cut off for a shield."
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah, the mother of the believers, narrated that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The most hated of men to Allah is the most quarrelsome of opponents.'"
"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds) and Al-Muzaffat."
"He forbade Ad-Dubba' (gourds) specifically."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that 'Aishah, may Allah be pleased with her, said:

hadithText: 'Aishah said: "Drink but do not become intoxicated."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Simak, from Qirsafah, one of their womenfolk, that:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah did not leave behind a Dinar or a Dirham, or a sheep or a camel, and he did not leave any will."
"The Messenger of Allah did not leave behind a Dirham or a Dinar, or a sheep or a camel, and he did not leave any will."
"The Messenger of Allah died when no one was with him except me." She said: "And he called for a vessel."
"There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience and its expiation is the expiation for an oath."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience, and its expiation is the expiation for an oath.'"
"There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience, and its expiation is the expiation for an oath."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience, and its expiation is the expiation for an oath.'"
"There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience, and its expiation is the expiation for an oath."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "There is no vow to commit an act of disobedience, and its expiation is the expiation for an oath."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: It was narrated from 'Aishah that she used to perform Ghusl with the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) from a single vessel.
"The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used not to perform Wudu' after Ghusl."
"I used to comb the hair of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) when I was menstruating."
Something similar was narrated by Malik, from Az-Zuhri, from 'Urwah, from 'Aishah.
"I used to rub it off from the garment of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH)."
"I used to see it on the garment of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) and scratch it off."
"I remember rubbing the Janabah from the garment of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH)."
"I remember finding it on the garment of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) and scratching it off."
It was narrated from Aisha that Abu Bakr led the people in prayer and the Messenger of Allah (saws)was in the row.
It was narrated from 'Aishah that she used to perform Ghusl with the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) from a single vessel.
It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to perform Ghusl with a Mudd and Ghusl with approximately a Sa'.
"The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to perform Ghusl with a Mudd and Ghusl with a Sa'."
"I used to comb the hair of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) while I was menstruating."
"The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) would not perform Wudu' after Ghusl."
"We set out with the Messenger of Allah (saws) thinking that it was for nothing other than Hajj."
I and the Messenger of Allah (saws) used to take bath with a brass vessel.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) appointed Dhat Irq as the place for putting on ihram for the people of Iraq.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) sacrificed a cow for his wives at the Farewell Pilgrimage.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) performed two umrahs: one umrah in Dhul-Qa'dah, and the other in Shawwal.
The Prophet (saws) postponed the circumambulation on the day of sacrifice till the night.
hadithNarrated: Narrated Aisha, Ummul Mu'minin ; Abdullah Ibn Abbas:

hadithText: The Prophet (saws) said: What is unlawful by reason of consanguinity is unlawful by reason of fosterage.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) used to kiss me when he was fasting and when I was fasting.
The Prophet (saws) used to kiss her and suck her tongue when he was fasting.
The month most liked by the Messenger of Allah (saws) for fasting was Sha'ban. He then joined it with Ramadan.
When Negus died, we were told that a light would be seen perpetually at his grave.
A woman would give security from the believers and it would be allowed.
The Prophet (saws) used to take a bath on account of sexual defilement, on Friday, for cupping and washing the dead.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said: Profit follows responsibility.
The man casting evil would be commanded to perform ablution, and then the man affected was washed with it.
I heard the Messenger of Allah (saws) read: "(There is for him) Rest and satisfaction" (faruhun wa rayhan).
The bedding of the Messenger of Allah (saws) consisted of leather stuffed with palm fibre.
The hair of the Messenger of Allah (saws) were above wafrah and below jummah.
I never heard the Messenger of Allah (saws) attributing anyone to anything except to religion.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) did not leave dinars, dirhams, camels and goats, nor did he leave will for anything.
Aishah, also reported a tradition bearing similar meaning through another chain of transmitters.
A similar tradition has also been transmitted by 'Aishah through a different chain of narrators. But the former is more perfect.
The tradition mentioned above has also been transmitted by 'Aishah through a different chain of narrators to the same effect.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) never left in his house anything containing the figure of a cross without destroying it.
The Prophet (saws) was covered with striped Yemen garment (after his death).
That the Messenger of Allah (saws) was shrouded in a garment of Yemeni stuff, it was then removed from him.
The Prophet (saws) as saying: No vow must be taken to do an act of disobedience, and the atonement for it is the same as for an oath.
The Prophet (saws) never omitted four rak'ahs before the noon prayer, and two rak'ahs before the dawn prayer.
When he was with me he would sleep at dawn. By this she referred to the Prophet (saws).
The Prophet (saws) used to pray thirteen rak'ahs during the night including the two rak'ahs of the dawn prayer.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) liked comprehensive supplication and abandoned other kinds.
I never saw the Messenger of Allah (saws) fasting during the first ten days of Dhu al-Hijjah.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) offered the prayer in his apartment and people were following him behind apartment.
The Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "Whoever innovates something in this matter of ours (i.e. Islam) that is not part of it, will have it rejected."
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'O Allah! Strengthen Islam with 'Umar bin Khattab in particular.'"
'The Messenger of Allah said: ''Ammar- no two things were shown to him but he chose the better of the two.''
"The Messenger of Allah used to perform ablution with a Mudd (of water) and bath with a Sa'."
The Messenger of Allah used to remember Allah in all circumstances.
"I never saw the Messenger of Allah come out of the toilet without first (cleansing himself) with water."
"The Messenger of Allah and I would take a bath from a single vessel."
The Prophet did ablution washing each part three times.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah and Abu Hurairah that:

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah said: 'Woe to the heels because of Hell-fire.'"
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'Perform ablution after (eating) that which has been changed by fire.'"
"A baby boy was brought to the Prophet who then urinated on him. He sprinkled over it with water and did not wash it."
"I often scraped it (semen) from the garment of the Messenger of Allah with my hand."
"I remember when I found it (semen) on the garment of the Messenger of Allah and I scratched it off."
"The Messenger of Allah would not perform ablution after the bath to cleanse himself from sexual impurity."
"When the Messenger of Allah wanted to sleep and he was sexually impure, he would perform ablution as for prayer."
"If the Messenger of Allah wanted to eat when he was sexually impure, he would perform ablution."
If the Prophet wanted to eat when he was sexually impure, he would wash his hands.
"The Messenger of Allah used to put his head in my lap when I was menstruating and recite Qur'an."
"The Prophet prayed the 'Asr when the sun was shining into my room and there were no shadows yet."
"The Messenger of Allah did not sleep before the 'Isha' nor stay up (talking) after it."
The Messenger of Allah commanded that mosque to be built in (Ad-Dur) villages, and that they be purified and perfumed.
The Messenger of Allah commanded that places of prayer be established in villages, and that they be purified and perfumed.
The Prophet scratched some spittle from the prayer direction of the mosque.
"A devil chasing a devil."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet(SAW) looked at a man who was chasing a bird and said:

hadithText: "Allah is Gentle and loves gentleness in all things."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that the Prophet(SAW) said:

hadithText: that the Prophet Allah said: “Suckling once or twice does not make (marriage) unlawful.”
that whenever the Messenger of Allah was to travel, he would cast lots among his wives.
"The Messenger of Allah never beat any of his servants, or wives, and his hand never hit anything."
"Aishah told me that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: 'There is no divorce and no manumission at the time of coercion.' "
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Safiyyah bint Shaibah said:

hadithText: "Barirah was told to observe the waiting period for three menstrual cycles."
"There is no vow to commit disobedience, and the expiation (for such a vow) is the expiation for breaking an oath."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said:

hadithText: the Messenger of Allah (SAW) ruled that what a slave earns belongs to his guarantor.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that :

hadithText:
“If a man
stays among a people, he should not fast without their permission.”
hadithNarrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Aishah that the Prophet (saw) said:

hadithText:
“The Messenger of Allah (saw) used
to
fast ‘Ashura’, and he ordered (others) to fast it too.”

“The Messenger of Allah (saw)
applied
kohl to his eyes while he was fasting.”
